results.title: Schindler's list
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Branko Lustig, Gerald Molen, Amblin Entertainment and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: Staggering adaptation of Thomas Keneally’s novel of the same name about an Austrian businessman who, during the Second World War, saved 1,100 Polish Jews from Nazi slaughter by using them in his factory manufacturing crockery for the German Army. Filmed almost entirely on location in Poland in gritty monochrome, this is a brilliantly realised, fiercely controlled and restrained treatment of a true story. Harsh and compassionate, it avoids sentimentality until the end. The three central performances, Liam Neeson who is towering as Oskar Schindler, Ben Kingsley as his Jewish accountant and Ralph Fiennes as the odious Nazi Commandant Amon Goeth, are unforgettable. Winner of seven Academy Awards for: Best Picture of the Year, Best Achievement in Directing, Best Screenplay based on Material Previously Produced or Published, Best Achievement in Cinematography, Best Achievement in Film Editing, Best Achievement in Music, and Best Production Design.

results.title: Scenes from a marriage
results.brief_description: A passionate, probing and honest look at a marriage, its disintegration and the relationship that follows. Liv Ullman and Erland Josephson are remarkable throughout this intimate and often painful portrait which Bergamn originally made as 6 50 minute episodes for television and subsequently edited into a full-length feature. Bergman examines the trauma of a beleagured marriage largely in close-up creating an exhaustive study of the doubt, despair, confusion and loneliness experienced by Marianne on discovering her husband’s infidelity with a younger woman. Swedish language with English subtitles.

results.title: Scary movie [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Keenen Ivory Wayans, Lee Mayes, Eric Gold and Dimension Pictures
results.brief_description: The popularity of teenage slasher films in the 1980’s and 1990’s including ‘I Know What You Did Last Summer ‘, ‘Halloween’ and the ‘Scream’ trilogy lead to this parody film directed by Keenen Ivory Wayans. Ray, Brenda, Buffy, Shorty, Ray, Greg, Bobby and Cindy are on the run from a serial killer, seeking his revenge after the kids run him over following their school prom. Also causing problems for the ditzy teens are a nosy reporter Gail Hailstorm, assistant police officer Doofy and high school principal, Squiggly. Incidentally, ‘Scary Movie’ was the working title for the original ‘Scream’ film. Cast includes Marlon Wayans, Shawn Wayans, Shannon Elizabeth, Regina Hall, Lochlyn Munro, Anna Faris and Jon Abrahams.

results.title: Santa sangre (D)
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Jodorowsky, Claudio Argento and Intersound
results.brief_description: Like some Fellini-esque nightmare, this mix of circus freaks (tattooed lady, an exotic midget, sad faced clowns), bizarre religious imagery (an armless virgin saint, a cult of holy blood) and hallucinatory imagery (writhing snakes, zombie brides) abounds with disturbing psychological undercurrents. “A strange, violent but ultimately liberating vision.” - Time Out.

results.title: Santa Fe trail. The Cuba story
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz and Jack L. Warner
results.brief_description: A saga on the American civil war starring Errol Flynn, Olivia de Havilland and Ronald Reagan. Flynn plays Jeb Stuart, a military man who travels in pursuit of John Brown, leader of a violent anti-slavery campaign. Reagan plays George Custer, romantic rival and West Point classmate of Flynn’s. It is an action packed but ambiguous portrayal of the American civil war and its protagonists who held intensively opposing views. In this collectors edition rehearsal footage is also featured, along with “The Cuba Story”, a documentary on Errol Flynn’s interest and involvement in Cuba and in Fidel Castro.

results.title: Santa Claus is coming tonight
results.creator_credit: Pierre Heberrt, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A combination of live-action footage and animation creates a film that is an effective reminder that Christmas is fast disappearing under a mountain of crass commercialism: Santa Clauses that operate on a tight time schedule, a landscape shorn of evergreens, a cornucopia of toys and gadgets, and a cacophony of noise. The story is biting, the drawings are pointed, and the feast of Christmas stands divested of its slick trappings.

results.title: Sansho Dayu = Sansho the bailiff
results.brief_description: The story of Sansho Dayu, set in the harsh feudal world of eleventh century Japan, is based on an ancient legend. The son and daughter of a noble family are kidnapped and sold as slaves to a tyrannical bailiff, Sansho. The son, young Zushio (Hanayagi), is left with a creed of compassion from his exiled father, “Without mercy, a man is like a beast”. The film is played out as a parable of redemption, a struggle for the soul of Zushio, torn between his good (but absent) father, exiled for daring to treat peasants as human beings, and the ‘bad’ father, bailiff Sansho, into whose clutches he falls and whose cruel attitudes he starts to adopt. Years later, the son escapes and is reunited with his now blind, crippled and impoverished mother. Mizoguchi’s haunting cinematography translates into a humanist statement of injustice and suffering. Based on the novel “Sansho Dayu” by Ogai Mori. Cast includes Kinuyo Tanaka, Yoshiaki Hanayagi, Kyoko Kagawa and Eitaro Shindo. In Japanese with English subtitles.
